title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 06 November 2014 - XWiki
content:
<momomomomo> has quit

06:03 <Denis> has joined #xwiki

09:28 <msmeria> has quit  
09:29 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
09:35 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:41 <msmeria> has quit  
09:42 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
09:43 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:54 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
10:07 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
10:07 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:13 <vmassol> good morning  
10:13 <vmassol> reminder: master is now 6.4-SNAPSHOT, so if you make changrs for 6.3 you need to merge them ;)  
10:13 <gdelhumeau> a pitty it has been done during a BFD  
10:14 <vmassol> acutally good  
10:14 <gdelhumeau> because basically, we will merge everything we do  
10:14 <vmassol> BFD are very dangerous  
10:14 <vmassol> not everything  
10:14 <vmassol> only important bugs and non dangerous ones  
10:14 <vmassol> I remember that after BFD we used to have stabilization issues in the past  
10:14 <mflorea> yes, committing all fixes done during BFD on 6.3 is dangerous  
10:14 <gdelhumeau> ok  
10:15 <vmassol> right now we're NOT supposed to commit anything anymore except blockers  
10:15 <msmeria> has quit  
10:15 <vmassol> (for 6.3)  
10:15 <mflorea> yep, exactly  
10:15 <gdelhumeau> and bugs that are not blockers ? we will merge them for 6.3  
10:16 <gdelhumeau> 6.3.1 sorry  
10:16 <gdelhumeau> ?  
10:16 <vmassol> either that or 6.4 yes  
10:16 <vmassol> not sure we need 6.3.1 actually  
10:16 <vmassol> since 6.4 is a stabilization release  
10:16 <vmassol> and we've made 6.2.x stable already  
10:16 <vmassol> (for people who need a 6.x now)  
10:17 <vmassol> we'll see how good 6.3 is I guess and we have important blockers we can decide to release a 6.3.1 urgently, let's hope not :)  
10:17 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
10:17 <msmeria> has quit  
10:17 <vmassol> s/and we have/and if we have  
10:18 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
10:20 <gdelhumeau> do we plan to release a 6.2.5 too?  
10:20 <vmassol> don't know  
10:21 <vmassol> right now I'd like that we release a 6.2.4 ;)  
10:21 <vmassol> (sent a mail)  
10:21 <vmassol> if 6.3 is good enough  
10:21 <vmassol> then I don't think we'll need a 6.2.5  
10:21 <vmassol> so we'll see  
10:21 <vmassol> it's for us to decide...  
10:23 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
10:27 <Slashman\_> has joined #xwiki  
10:30 <Slashman> has quit  
10:40 <vmassol> guys, should I merge http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-11401 on 6.3 branch? :)  
10:49 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
10:52 <msmeria> has quit  
10:53 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
11:16 <evalica> has quit  
11:31 <DarkKnightCZ> hi, i  
11:32 <DarkKnightCZ> i'm just wondering, is it possible to delay jgroups event sending? (i'm facing issue when documentupdated/created event is received by node when database isn't fully replicated, thus failing with "document revision does not exist" and still showing the old version of document)  
11:47 <Slashman\_> has quit  
11:47 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
12:11 <woshilapin> has quit  
12:15 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: not sure but jgroups support an insane number of configuration so I would not be surprised if it support that  
12:17 <tmortagne> looks like it does, I find reference to DELAY property when quickly searching on google  
12:18 <tmortagne> http://www.jgroups.org/javadoc/org/jgroups/protocols/DELAY.html  
12:18 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
12:26 <ClemensR> has left #xwiki  
12:27 <DarkKnightCZ> tmortagne: nice, thanks, i will look into it  
12:28 <Slashman> has quit  
12:54 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
13:19 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: if it's not dangerous for 6.2.4 it's not for 6.3  
13:19 <tmortagne> so it's both or none IMO

16:27 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
16:44 <woshilapin> has quit  
16:46 <vmassol> mflorea: something I'm marking to read for later, you might find it interesting too: http://pascalprecht.github.io/2014/10/25/integrating-web-components-with-angularjs/  
16:47 <mflorea> sounds interesting from the title, thanks!  
16:47 <mflorea> (bookmarked!)  
16:51 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
16:53 <evalica> just reported XWIKI-11407  
16:53 <vmassol> wow  
16:53 <vmassol> where are our functional tests? :)  
16:54 <vmassol> that's a pretty basic feature for which we need a test  
16:54 <vmassol> (if we don't have one already)  
16:54 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: any idea?  
16:55 <gdelhumeau> we have a test  
16:55 <vmassol> so we should check why it passes  
16:55 <vmassol> :)  
16:55 <vmassol> mabye it's not good enough  
16:55 <vmassol> (or caty's issue is not right! ;))  
16:55 <gdelhumeau> the title is wrong  
16:56 <evalica> correct the title :) if you want.. the thing is that I cannot create wikis anymore :P  
16:56 <gdelhumeau> sorry evalica, but yes it is wrong and I am changing it  
16:56 <gdelhumeau> evalica: are you logged on the subwiki?  
16:57 <evalica> it's a vanilla localhost - the only thing maybe is that is on port:8086  
17:02 <Lyes> has quit  
17:07 <gdelhumeau> are you logged on?  
17:07 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
17:07 <evalica> ofc - you cannot reproduce it?  
17:08 <ClemensR> I just created a wiki with  6.3-milestone-2 ... so if it is the code it must be a recent one  
17:08 <gdelhumeau> damn, I reproduce  
17:08 <gdelhumeau> but the wiki is created  
17:09 <gdelhumeau> DW is trigerred, this is the problem  
17:09 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: any idea?  
17:09 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: did not followed what was the issue  
17:10 <gdelhumeau> we create a new subwiki (without a template)  
17:10 <gdelhumeau> but when we reach it, DW is not triggered  
17:10 <evalica> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-11407  
17:10 <tmortagne> nop, no idea what could be the issue, there is nothing very recent in DW code  
17:11 <tmortagne> would need to debug  
17:11 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: in the wiki test module, I do not have DW neither, that is why the tests are passing  
17:11 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: I just do my test on an empty wiki basically  
17:12 <gdelhumeau> but it could be interesting to have DW in it  
17:12 <vmassol> yes  
17:12 <vmassol> a real func tests need to test end to end  
17:12 <vmassol> as a user would do  
17:12 <vmassol> to be sure nothing is missed  
17:12 <vmassol> (ideally)  
17:13 <vmassol> at least this shows we probably need to do that for this use cas in the future ;)  
17:14 <tmortagne> evalica: are you logged in when you end up on that new wiki ?  
17:14 <tmortagne> and do you have admin right on it  
17:15 <tmortagne> same question for gdelhumeau since you reproduced actually  
17:15 <evalica> tmortagne: yes - I have Admin - I can edit subwiki:Main.WebHome and enter in Administration to use the Import  
17:15 <evalica> but the wiki is empty  
17:16 <tmortagne> anything in http://127.0.0.1:8080/xwiki/wiki/marketing/distribution/XWiki/Distribution ?  
17:17 <evalica> "The requested document could not be found."  
17:17 <evalica> no  
17:17 <tmortagne> what ?  
17:17 <tmortagne> that does not make sense  
17:18 <evalica> you can download 6.3-RC1 if you want :P  
17:18 <tmortagne> sounds like it did not even ended up in distribution action  
17:18 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: logged with the global admin  
17:19 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: http://tof.canardpc.com/preview2/2d6ffc1e-75f0-4233-9862-774f44f9c77d.jpg  
17:20 <gdelhumeau> actually: http://tof.canardpc.com/view/2d6ffc1e-75f0-4233-9862-774f44f9c77d.jpg  
17:20 <tmortagne> ok that make more sense  
17:20 <tmortagne> so the distribution is not running it seems  
17:20 <tmortagne> which mean you should have a status stored  
17:20 <tmortagne> in jobs/status/distribution/  
17:21 <tmortagne> downloading it, will have to debug to understand what changed but it's not DW code  
17:24 <evalica> tmortagne: gdelhumeau the issue does not reproduce on 6.2.3 so it's something that changed in the past week  
17:25 <tmortagne> evalica: there is things committed in 6.3 branch and not in 6.2, what is more interresting is that ClemensR say it's working in 6.3M2  
17:26 <evalica> k :) ty for explanation - makes sense :) I was just glad my release was not affected :P  
17:29 <tmortagne> and of course I don't have the issue on master, that would be too easy to debug...  
17:29 <tmortagne> testing with 6.3-SNAPSHOT first maybe it's been fixed by a recent commit  
17:29 <tmortagne> (whatever that is)  
17:34 <gdelhumeau> I am on 6.4-SNAPSHOT  
17:34 <Enygma`> ClemensR: I understand you are working on an issue I have already fixed http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-11391  
17:34 <Enygma`> Caty just told me  
17:35 <ClemensR> Enygma`:  yes, I just noticed a few moments ago ...  
17:35 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: I'm directly on master and I got the DW when creating a new wiki  
17:35 <mflorea> has quit  
17:35 <Enygma`> Manuel tested 6.3M2 which was obviously outdated and I consider that to be a bad practice anyway.  
17:35 <tmortagne> the difference with what is built by jenkins is that I may not have the latest wiki pages on main wiki  
17:36 <ClemensR> well, the rc-1 has not made it to the download page, that is maybe why Manuel considered the 6.3-m2 recent  
17:38 <tmortagne> on 6.3-SNAPSHOT I don't get the DW indeed  
17:38 <tmortagne> unless it's random  
17:38 <tmortagne> lets see if I can reproduce in debug mode now  
17:39 <tmortagne> hmm there is something very weird actually  
17:39 <tmortagne> I don't have any DW status  
17:39 <tmortagne> not even for the main wiki  
17:40 <tmortagne> like if the DW was not called at all  
17:40 <tmortagne> so something to do with events  
17:42 <evalica> has quit  
17:42 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: if you delete the data, do you even get a DW for the main wiki ?  
17:42 <tmortagne> from what I see you probably won't  
17:43 <gdelhumeau> I don't know, I 'm working on that wiki :)  
17:46 <Enygma`> has quit  
17:46 <tmortagne> hmm the issue is that the manifest does not contains what it's supposed to  
17:46 <tmortagne> and it's actually quite weird  
17:46 <tmortagne> Built-By: kutzi  
17:47 <tmortagne> it's supposed to be  
17:47 <tmortagne> Built-By: hudsonagent  
17:47 <tmortagne> and the missing info is  
17:47 <tmortagne> XWiki-Extension-Id: org.xwiki.enterprise:xwiki-enterprise-web  
17:48 <tmortagne> which means that DW does not find any distribution information  
17:48 <tmortagne> so we have a build issue somewhere  
17:54 <tmortagne> I don't have the issue on master because I use xwiki-debug-eclipse for which the manifeste is generated by eclipse  
17:55 <tmortagne> manifest  
17:58 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: any idea if we started include some external WAR in ours between 6.3M2 and 6.3RC1 ?  
17:59 <tmortagne> the manifest we have in the XE WAR is clearly not the one generated for XE itself  
17:59 <tmortagne> (see the issue)  
18:01 <tmortagne> actually it's not the XE WAR which is broken, it's jetty/hsqldb distribution  
18:01 <tmortagne> so it's during this distribution creation  
18:03 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: you tested with a jetty/hsqldb distibution, right ?  
18:05 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: yes  
18:05 <gdelhumeau> builded with https://github.com/gdelhumeau/xwiki-build-script  
18:05 <gdelhumeau> aaaaah ok  
18:06 <gdelhumeau> makes me thing abouty something  
18:06 <gdelhumeau> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-11330  
18:07 <gdelhumeau> can it be related ?  
18:08 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: I don't think so, the WAR is good as far as I can see  
18:08 <tmortagne> it's only jetty/hsqldb  
18:08 <tmortagne> distribution  
18:09 <tmortagne> from what I understand XWIKI-11330 is about adding more jars in the WAR  
18:09 <tmortagne> ha wait  
18:09 <tmortagne> jetty distribution indeed  
18:09 <tmortagne> I don't understand what this has to do with jetty  
18:09 <tmortagne> maybe just a wrong title  
18:10 <tmortagne> yes the commit is in XE web so nothing to do with jetty  
18:10 <tmortagne> lets find first from where this manifest could come, there is not much clues in it  
18:10 <gdelhumeau> ok  
18:10 <tmortagne> it's definitely not a XWiki thing that's for sure  
18:19 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki
